[File: stacks-core/stackslib/src/net/codec.rs] [Function: StackerDBChunkInvData::consensus_deserialize()] [Version Overflow] The slot_versions are Vec<u32>, but if an attacker sends maximum u32 values for all slots, could this cause overflow in version comparison logic downstream? (Medium)

[File: stacks-core/stackslib/src/net/codec.rs] [Function: StackerDBChunkInvData::consensus_deserialize()] [Replica Count] The num_outbound_replicas is read but not validated - could 0 or excessively large values cause replication failures or DoS? (Medium)

[File: stacks-core/stackslib/src/net/codec.rs] [Function: StackerDBGetChunkData::consensus_deserialize()] [Version Mismatch] If slot_version doesn't match the actual chunk version, does downstream code handle this gracefully, or could version confusion cause data corruption? (High)

[File: stacks-core/stackslib/src/net/codec.rs] [Function: StackerDBPushChunkData::consensus_deserialize()] [Chunk Data Validation] The chunk_data is deserialized but not validated for signature correctness here - could an attacker push chunks with invalid signatures that are only caught later, wasting resources?
